h1.title: Convert JPG to ICO Online
h1.description: Free and fast JPG to ICO converter optimized for favicons and Windows desktop icons. Works instantly — no signup required.

converter.title: JPG to ICO Converter
converter.description: Convert JPG images to ICO for websites and Windows apps.

h2.title: Why Convert JPG to ICO?
h2.description:
ICO is the standard format for Windows icons and favicons:

  • Multi-size container: Include several resolutions in one file.
  • Favicon standard: Works across major browsers.
  • Windows compatibility: Native desktop/app icon support.
  • Crisp at small sizes: Optimized for 16–256 px displays.

Note: JPG doesn't have transparency. For transparent icons, start from PNG.

h2.title: How to Convert JPG to ICO Online
h2.description:
1. Click Upload JPG and select your image.
  2. Wait for processing and optimization.
  3. Click Download ICO to get your icon.

We generate common icon sizes automatically.

h2.title: ICO Format Specifications
h2.description:
• Standard sizes: 16×16, 32×32, 48×48, 64×64, 128×128, 256×256 px
  • Color depth: Up to 32-bit RGBA (alpha)
  • Transparency: Full alpha channel supported
  • Structure: Header + multiple image entries
  • Compression: PNG-compressed entries for 32-bit icons (Vista+)

h2.title: Supported Limits & Formats
h2.description:
• Accepted input: JPG/JPEG (image/jpeg)
  • Max file size: up to 16 MB per file
  • Output: ICO (.ico, MIME image/x-icon)

h2.title: Troubleshooting
h2.description:
• Jagged edges: Start from a higher-resolution source; sharp edges downscale better.
  • Need transparency: Convert PNG to ICO so alpha is preserved.
  • Favicon not showing: Clear cache and ensure /favicon.ico is at the site root and linked with <link rel="icon" href="/favicon.ico">.
  • Upload fails: Make sure the file is JPG/JPEG and ≤ 16 MB.

h2.title: What is JPG?
h2.description: JPG (JPEG) uses lossy compression for small file sizes — ideal for photos and web use, but it does not support transparency.

h2.title: What is ICO?
h2.description: ICO is the Windows and favicon icon format that can bundle multiple sizes and color depths into a single file, supporting alpha transparency.

h2.title: Use Cases: When to Convert JPG to ICO
h2.description:
• Favicon creation: Generate a single favicon.ico with multiple sizes.
  • Windows apps/shortcuts: Turn logos into desktop/app icons.
  • Brand consistency: Ensure crisp, consistent icons across resolutions.

faq.question: Is this JPG to ICO converter free?
faq.answer: Yes, the converter is completely free with no hidden charges or subscriptions.

faq.question: What sizes are supported in ICO files?
Can I use ICO files for website favicons?
faq.answer: Yes. favicon.ico is widely supported across major browsers.

faq.question: What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: You can upload images up to 16 MB per file.

faq.question: Are my files safe?
faq.answer: Files are processed automatically and not retained longer than necessary for conversion.

faq.question: Will the icon quality be good?
faq.answer: We optimize for common icon sizes and use PNG-compressed entries for sharp results.

faq.question: Can I use this tool on my phone?
faq.answer: Yes. The converter is mobile-friendly and works on iOS and Android browsers.

faq.question: Does JPG support transparency in ICO?
faq.answer: JPG has no transparency. If you need transparent icons, convert PNG to ICO instead.

note: For transparent icons, start with PNG input. Place /favicon.ico at your site root and reference it with <link rel="icon" href="/favicon.ico">.
